title: DW-testare
description:
**Uppdrag:** Testautomation inom Data Warehouse (DW)
  
Vi söker en erfaren och tekniskt skicklig testautomationsspecialist med gedigen bakgrund inom data warehouse och molnbaserade plattformar. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i arbetet med att säkra kvaliteten i ett avancerat informationsförsörjningssystem som bygger på moderna teknologier såsom Azure och Snowflake. Uppdraget innefattar allt från analys och design till utveckling av helautomatiserade testramverk.
  
  

**Ansvarsområden:**  

Utvärdera, förbättra och implementera nya strategier och angreppssätt för automatiserade tester som en integrerad del av den kontinuerliga utvecklingsprocessen (SDLC).
  
Arbeta med verktyg som Robot Framework och X-Automate (XAM) för att utveckla och förbättra automatiserade testlösningar.
  
Föreslå och genomföra kvalitetsförbättringar i befintliga testaktiviteter i linje med agila ramverk såsom SAFe.
  
Stötta utvecklingsteamen med testkompetens och bidra till kunskapsöverföring inom organisationen.
  
Samarbeta nära med andra funktioner inom verksamheten för att säkerställa testbarhet, spårbarhet och kvalitet i dataleveranser.
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:****Obligatoriska:**  

Minst 6 års erfarenhet av testautomatisering i data warehouse-miljöer.
  
Gedigen erfarenhet av SQL och testning av datakällor.
  
Kunskap om testning i analysplattformar och förståelse för molnteknologi.
  
Förtrogenhet med Azure DevOps och ISTQB Foundation-certifiering.
  
Minst 1 års erfarenhet av datakällesintegration (data sourcing) till DWH.
  
Tidigare arbete med molnbaserade lösningar såsom Snowflake.
  
Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

ISTQB Advanced Level Test Analyst-certifiering eller motsvarande.
  
Erfarenhet av SAFe eller liknande agila ramverk.
  
Kunskap om Azure Data Lake och Azure Data Factory.
  
Erfarenhet av filbaserad testning (import/export).
  
Domänkunskap inom försäkringssystem.
  
Grundläggande programmeringskunskap i Python.
  
  

**Personliga egenskaper:**  

Vi söker dig som är lösningsorienterad, strukturerad och kommunikativ. Du trivs i en agil och tekniskt komplex miljö, tar ansvar för ditt arbete och har lätt för att samarbeta. Förmågan att tänka analytiskt och agera pragmatiskt är avgörande för att lyckas i uppdraget.
  
Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: AI platform/Data enginner
description:
En tekniskt avancerad aktör inom datadrivna lösningar söker en erfaren konsult som vill vara med och vidareutveckla en kraftfull och flexibel AI- och dataplattform. Uppdraget sträcker sig från september till december 2025 och är beläget i Stockholm. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i en hybridmiljö där både lokala system och molnbaserade lösningar samspelar, med ett tydligt fokus på automatisering, plattformsförbättring och effektivisering av pipelinehantering för maskininlärning.


Du kommer att ingå i ett team där nära samarbete med data scientists och ML-ingenjörer är en självklarhet. Tillsammans arbetar ni för att ta AI-modeller från idé till produktion, med robusthet, säkerhet och skalbarhet i fokus. Rollen är bred och innefattar ansvar för hela livscykeln – från datakälla till produktionssatt modell. Du förväntas bidra med både teknisk expertis och strategisk input i hur plattformen ska vidareutvecklas.


Arbetet bedrivs i en Linuxbaserad miljö, där containerteknik, CI/CD och DevOps-principer utgör grunden. Du kommer att arbeta praktiskt med datamodellering, orkestrering, automatisering av dataflöden och hantering av infrastruktur genom kod. Det här är en roll för dig som gillar att jobba nära tekniken och samtidigt vara med och forma den större helheten.

**Vi söker dig som har:**

* En gedigen teknisk bakgrund och minst fyra års erfarenhet inom Data Engineering, plattformsutveckling eller MLOps
* Stark förståelse för mjukvaruutveckling och systemarkitektur
* Erfarenhet av datamodellering, orkestrering och validering
* God kännedom om verktyg som dbt, Prefect eller Spark (meriterande)
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Python och SQL
* Erfarenhet av containerbaserad utveckling, exempelvis med Docker eller Kubernetes i Linuxmiljö
* Erfarenhet av testdriven utveckling (fördel)
* Tidigare arbete med driftsättning av maskininlärningsmodeller i produktionsmiljöer (fördel)
* Kunskaper inom infrastruktur som kod, t.ex. Terraform och Ansible (meriterande)

**Vi tror att du är:**

* Nyfiken, praktiskt lagd och gillar att ta ansvar för helheten
* Intresserad av att bidra till plattformens tekniska riktning och framtida utveckling
* Strukturerad och initiativtagande
* En god lagspelare med förmåga att samarbeta i tvärfunktionella team
* En person som trivs i en tekniskt utmanande miljö där innovation står i fokus

**Om Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Physical Portfolio Operations Manager
description:
Physical Portfolio Operations Manager (f/m/d)  

**Workload: 80-100%**

**Location: Malmö, Oslo, Helsinki**

  

Join Axpo as a Physical Portfolio Operations Manager, where you will manage and optimize physical desk positions, support trading and finance teams, and build robust customer solutions for physical electricity trading and ancillary services. This role offers growth towards specialized operational or commercial portfolio management.

### **What you will do:**

* Implement customer solutions for physical electricity supply and ancillary services in collaboration with the Physical Desk and Originators.
* Trade and optimize multi-market assets including wind, solar, BESS, and hybrid systems using data-driven tools.
* Support the operations team with trading solution implementations for customers.
* Participate in projects related to regulatory changes or customer solution implementation.
* Ensure stable, safe, legal, and regulatory-compliant trading operations and portfolio management.
* Manage stakeholder relationships with Axpo’s subcontractors and TSOs.

### **What you bring & who you are:**

* Master’s degree or equivalent in Engineering, Finance, Computer Science, or related fields.
* Basic understanding of Nordic physical electricity and ancillary services markets, including TSO rules and platforms.
* Programming skills in Python, SQL, GIT, and Azure DevOps; basic database knowledge.
* Team-oriented with high attention to detail and structured work approach.
* Quick learner with logical thinking and ability to work calmly under stress.
* Fluent in English and at least one Nordic language.

### **About the team:**


You will be part of a supportive and innovative team focused on physical portfolio management and trading operations. The team values collaboration, continuous learning, and creativity to deliver effective solutions in a fast-evolving energy market.

title: Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)
description:
The Nym team is a world-class mix of privacy experts, engineers, and thinkers spread across Europe. We believe that user privacy underpins democratic freedoms in a networked world, and we're proud to help roll back the surveillance society.


We're looking for a SDET to lead the testing of our decentralised VPN across multiple platforms (Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, Linux). You’ll be the technical authority for ensuring performance, reliability, and security across complex distributed systems, with strong ownership of automation, networking validation, and DevOps integration.

**In the first month you might**

* Set up and stabilise test environments across all supported platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS)
* Build or improve automated test cases for VPN tunnels, networking flows, and security protocols
* Investigate cross-platform connectivity issues and contribute to root cause analysis
* Collaborate with engineers to define test strategies for upcoming decentralised networking features

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Cross-Platform Testing**: Design and implement test strategies for 5+ platforms; build automated test suites using WebDriverIO (web) and Appium (mobile).
* **Networking & VPN Validation**: Test tunnel stability, peer discovery, routing, and encryption protocols (WireGuard, OpenVPN, IPSec); troubleshoot DNS and network issues.
* **DevOps & CI/CD**: Manage automated test pipelines (GitHub Actions/GitLab CI); provision containerised environments (Docker); support CI for multi-platform builds.
* **Diagnostics & Incident Response**: Investigate critical bugs, network failures, and performance bottlenecks; lead root cause analysis and improve observability.
* **Collaboration & Process**: Partner with engineering teams to drive continuous improvement in test reliability and coverage.

**Technical Skills**

* **Automation**: Strong in Appium and WebDriverIO; experience with API testing, scripting (TypeScript/JavaScript, Bash), and CI/CD.
* **Networking**: Deep understanding of VPN protocols, NAT/firewalls, DNS, routing, and P2P networking.
* **Systems & CLI**: Comfortable across Windows/macOS/Linux; proficient with shell scripting, Docker/Kubernetes, and system admin tools.
* **Tooling**: Prometheus, Grafana, Wireshark, tcpdump, Terraform, Ansible, AWS.

**Requirements**

* Proven experience testing complex networked systems and VPNs.
* Hands-on with distributed system testing, cross-platform QA, and environment configuration.
* Strong DevOps and CI/CD practices in production environments.

**Nice to Have**

* Experience with blockchain, Tor/I2P, mesh networking.
* Security or compliance knowledge (e.g. data privacy, regulatory frameworks).
* Background in load testing and performance tuning.

**What we offer you:**

* A diverse, global team of 50+, interested in learning and solving problems together.
* 6 Weeks annual leave plus national holidays.
* Yearly learning and development allowance.
* IT hardware package tailored to your role.
* Remote working (with a bias towards being able to do in-person meetups periodically).
* A competitive salary.

title: AWS DevOps Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 AWS DevOps Engineer
   

  

**This** 
**is** 
**Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 We are seeking a versatile Software Engineer to join our Platform Engineering DevOps team, and work in a constantly evolving, dynamic, and agile environment, believing that the route to speed and stability is through automation. Teamwork, communication, and speaking your mind are of high importance to us, especially when they come with a curious mind, a willingness to grow, and exchange ideas and knowledge.
   

  

 In this role, along with a team of 8 members, you’ll set up AWS (Amazon Web Services) infrastructure which is handling millions of transactions worth billions of Euros. The team has a DevSecOps standpoint, owns, develops, and manages all Infrastructure as Code in AWS accounts, running 100s of containers and serverless functions; If you build it, you run it!
   

  

 If this looks exciting and you are eager to continue growing your professional capabilities with ongoing training and educational opportunities, come join us!
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
 Delivering the committed objectives that include adapting to any new needs to reach the goal
   

  

* On-call duty according to a rotating schedule
* Participate in your team's day-to-day activities including tools development, operations, maintenance, and support
* Being an active member in our agile events like daily stand-ups, planning, retros, and demos. etc.
* Foster team spirit, quality and technical agility


**Who Are We Looking For?**
 We Look For Big Thinkers. People Who Can Drive Positive Change, Step Up And Show What’s Next – People With Passion, Can-do Attitude And a Hunger To Learn And Grow. In Practice This Means
   

  

 You have proven experience in systems engineering, automating infrastructure creation & maintenance tasks using Docker, Jenkins, Terraform\ CloudFormation, etc.
   

  

* You have a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, distributed systems, software engineering, or another equivalent field
* You have relevant experience in supporting/operating transaction driven and highly available platforms running microservices with 99.99% uptime
* You have a curiosity about security solutions such as WAF, IDS/IPS, Anti-DDOS, and SIEM
* You have work experience in programming (Python scripting) and an interest in automation
* You are passionate about cloud services, pay attention to details, handle many different partners and you are accountable to deliver results in a fast-paced environment


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Being a part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide
* Health benefits contribution
* Health check – Every 2nd year
* Pension: BTP1 & BTP2
* Private Health Care Insurance (Euro Accident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape The Evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

**Learn More About Life At Worldline At Jobs.worldline.com**
 We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**DevOps Engineer** 




  





  





**The Role** 




  





  





 We are seeking a talented DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic Database Services (DBS) team. In this role, you will be responsible for architecting and developing automation solutions for our diverse database services. You will collaborate with a team of highly skilled professionals in a fast-paced environment, leveraging your automation and DevOps expertise to enhance our DBS offerings. We are looking for someone who is eager to apply their DevOps knowledge to improve automation across various databases, including Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Solace, Kafka, and AWS. While experience with these specific databases is not required, it is considered as a plus. A willingness to have a close collaboration within the team as well as learning and adapting is essential.
 



  





  





**Main responsibilities:** 




  





  




* Lead the automation efforts to deliver a scalable database environment
* Participate in the definition of the requirements on the infrastructure for the services DBS are responsible for
* Participate in tests and verification of new products within DBS responsibilities
* Collaborate to achieve common goals both within the team and across departments
* Keep up to date with new automation and infrastructure technologies
* Foster a culture of knowledge sharing and mentoring
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





  





**Skills and Requirements** 




  





  




* Deep knowledge in building automation solution using Ansible, Python and Terraform – preferably 3+ year experience
* Experience in building scalable and distributed infrastructure
* It is an advantage if you have some knowledge in database administration, but not a requirement
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to contribute to architectural and tech management discussions
* Comfortable running workshops and training sessions
* Good at collaboration and both verbal and written communication.
* Development mindset focused on cost optimization and performance

title: Platform Engineer (DevOps)
company_industry: Financial Services and Technology, Information and Media
description:
MAJORITY is a groundbreaking all-in-one digital financial service app that includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, money remittance, and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.
 



  





 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions.
 



  





 We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country.
 



 We are a diverse group of people from over 40 different countries that come together every day and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances
 



  





**The Role** 




 MAJORITY are seeking a Platform Engineer (DevOps) to join our team and help us maintain our deployment pipelines, databases, infrastructure and security posture. You will be responsible for handling the non-functional aspects of the system, including on-call duties and conducting POCs with new technologies to improve ease of operation and cost savings. Additionally, you will be expected to script and automate day-to-day operations.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




 Assist the development teams with automation and architecture.
 



 Automate and drive security and compliance for PCI Level-1 and SOC2 compliance, DevSecOps.
 



 Improving the overall performance of the platform and all of its infrastructure with a focus on fast response time, scalability and resource allocation.
 



 Continuously further develop and improve the internal tools for dev teams and help driving towards continuous delivery.
 



 Continue the construction of a microservice architecture with the support of, among others, Kubernetes, Istio, Datadog, Elastic, Terraform.
 



  





**Requirements / Qualifications** 



* 5+ years of hands-on experience developing tools and platforms with in-depth experience from cloud providers.
* Extensive experience in Docker orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes or similar
* Solid Linux experience
* Development/Scripting experience preferably in Python
* Have an understanding and interest for CI/CD and experience with build tools/services such as AzureDevops or similar
* Production experience with monitoring, logging, and distributed systems



  





**Personal Skills** 



* Great communication skills
* Independent and self reliant
* Always striving for continuous improvements
* You're smart, get stuff done, have great energy, and thrive in a fast-paced environment
* A positive and passionate person who will put teamwork and collaboration above all else.



 We are MAJORITY. We are international, ambitious, kind, and inclusive. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: DevOps Tech Lead
description:
**About the Company** 




  





  





 We are seeking a passionate and innovative DevOps Tech Lead to join our Platform Delivery and Reliability Services (PDRS) team. If you excel in a dynamic and technically demanding environment, we want you on our team! Join us and become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence.
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




  





  





 As a DevOps Tech Lead, you will be solving architectural challenges, planning current and future work, as well as provide insight, communication and leadership. You will be instrumental in leading the development of a fully automated platform by overseeing the design and maintenance of Kubernetes environments as well as managing Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 




  





  




* Give strategic direction when it comes to design, implementation, and maintenance of CI/CD pipeline tools.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate DevOps practices into the development lifecycle.
* Enhance platform scalability, reliability, and security across cloud and on-premises environments.
* Drive DevOps best practices, fostering a culture of automation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Identify and analyze incidents, develop and implement effective solutions.
* Keep up to date with the latest tools, trends, and technologies, and share knowledge within the team.



  





  





**Qualifications** 




  





  




* Advanced or expert in all layers of the DevOps work field.
* Deep understanding of containerized applications and container orchestration tools such as Kubernetes, EKS etc.
* Advanced Kubernetes Administration skills.
* Expertise with IaC tools such as Terraform, Ansible, and Kubernetes Operator.
* Strong Linux administration skills.
* Excellent troubleshooting abilities.
* Strong knowledge within programming or scripting languages, such as Python and Groovy.
* Expertise in designing and building reusable CI/CD pipelines using industry-standard tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Bitbucket Pipelines, and TeamCity.
* Experience with private and public cloud technologies, such as VMware/Openstack, and AWS/GCP/Azure.
* Knowledge of registry and asset management tools such as Artifactory.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to foster partnerships and drive cross-functional alignment.
* Ability to clearly express requirements and expectations to a wide range of individuals - and to understand stakeholders' requirements and see how they influence the course of action.
* Identify and define technical solutions with respect to short, middle, and long-term strategies.
* Experience and interest in working with AI and AI tools is a plus.



  





  





**Pay range and compensation package** 




  





  





 Our world is hybrid. A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
 



  





  





**Equal Opportunity Statement** 




  





  





 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

title: Systems Engineer
description:
**About**
 Echandia Marine is a leading innovator in sustainable marine battery systems, providing cutting-edge technology to enable cleaner, more efficient marine transport. Our mission is to revolutionize the maritime industry through advanced battery technology, improving efficiency and reducing environmental impact.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are looking for a
 **Systems Engineer** 
 to lead the definition and documentation of system requirements. You will play a key role to translate customer and technical input into clear, structured requirements that guide product development and ensure regulatory compliance.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and manage system requirements from customer and internal input
* Document system specifications, interfaces, and traceability
* Collaborate with engineering, project, and customer teams
* Ensure compliance with marine and safety standards


**Your Profile**
* Degree in systems or electrical engineering (BSc/MSc) or similar
* 5+ years of experience in system development and requirements engineering
* Skilled to formulate requirements and do the right trade-offs to optimize customer properties.
* Structured and strong analytical skills
* Knowledge of standards (ISO, DNV, IEC) is a plus


**Why Join Echandia Marine?**
**Impact** 
 : Work on groundbreaking technology that will shape the future of sustainable marine transport.
   

  

**Growth** 
 : Develop your skills in a dual role that combines technical leadership with product strategy.
   

  

**Innovation** 
 : Join a culture that values creativity, collaboration and innovation at every level.
   

  

**Mission** 
 : Be part of a purpose-driven company working to make the marine industry cleaner and more efficient.
   

  

 The right candidate will be part of a fast growing, non-hierarchical and business focused scale-up company fighting climate change through zero-emission electrification.
   

  

 Echandia is challenging the maritime industry with safer electrification. Since its founding in 2018, Echandia has rapidly become a global leader in maritime battery systems, delivering nearly 70 systems for electrification projects worldwide. Our systems are tailored to optimize energy efficiency and reduce environmental impact, supporting the maritime industry’s transition towards sustainable operations. Based in Stockholm, we serve customers across the globe.

title: Head of Platforms
description:
*Do you love building scalable platforms and leading awesome tech teams? We’re looking for a Head of Platforms to head up two key groups—Build, Automation & Test and Infrastructure—and help shape the platforms that keep our games and services running smoothly*
**Role**
 As the Head of Platforms, you will be responsible for setting the strategic and operational direction for two key technology teams: Build, Automation & Test, and Infrastructure. Your primary goal is to deliver a resilient, scalable, and efficient development platform and cloud infrastructure that power Paradox’s games and services.
   

  

 This is a hands-on leadership position that blends technical guidance with team and process management. You’ll collaborate closely with developers, engineers, and key stakeholders to drive ongoing enhancements, ensuring optimal performance, availability, and security across both development and production environments.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities Include**
* Provide leadership, guidance, and development opportunities for both the Build, Automation & Test team and the Infrastructure team.
* Take ownership of cloud infrastructure operations and strategic oversight.
* Lead architectural decisions focused on ensuring scalability, high availability, cost efficiency, and robust security across cloud environments/platforms.
* Play an active role in shaping strategy and planning as part of the Central Tech & Services leadership team.
* Partner closely with other departments to maintain adherence to data protection regulations and cloud governance standards.
* Establish and uphold comprehensive security protocols and operational procedures for cloud services.
* Manage and optimize cloud expenditures, while overseeing Platform Services budgeting, vendor negotiations, and contract management.


**Qualifications**
 Must-Have:
   

  

* Demonstrated success in leading high-performing technical teams within DevOps, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), infrastructure, and/or build automation domains.
* Deep expertise in continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) systems.
* Practical experience with cloud infrastructure, (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Well-versed in automated testing frameworks and tools.
* Exceptional leadership abilities with strong communication and collaboration skills.


**Nice-to-Have**
* Experience in the games industry or with game development.
* Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools and automation (e.g. Terraform).
* Understanding of observability tools and monitoring frameworks (e.g. Datadog, Prometheus, Grafana).
* Exposure to container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes, Docker).


*Want to shape the tech behind legendary games? Take charge of how we build, test, and launch at scale—while leading the platforms that keep everything blazing fast, rock solid, and battle-ready. If you're driven by impact and love moving at full throttle—apply now!*
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
🚀 Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer – Stockholm (Hybrid)
 



  





**Be the First. Build the Future.** 




  





 Our client - a fast-growing SaaS innovator used by global enterprises - is launching a brand-new AI initiative. They’re looking for a
 **Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer** 
 to be the founding member of this team and lead the charge in embedding cutting-edge AI into their product suite.
 



  





 🧠 What You’ll Do
 



 As the first dedicated AI engineer, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of AI within the company. This is a hands-on, high-impact role where you’ll:
 



  




* **Architect and build** 
 AI-powered features and infrastructure from the ground up.
* **Design and implement** 
 GenAI tools and agentic workflows - think chatbots, LLMs, RAG pipelines, and more.
* **Collaborate closely** 
 with product and engineering leadership to define the AI roadmap and long-term vision.
* **Prototype and productionise** 
 AI features that enhance user experience and drive product innovation.
* **Evaluate and integrate** 
 technologies like AWS Bedrock and other GenAI platforms to accelerate development.
* **Influence architectural decisions** 
 in a microservices-based environment, ensuring scalability and performance.
* **Mentor and guide** 
 future hires as the AI team grows around you.



  





 🛠️ What You Bring
 



 This isn’t a role for a pure data scientist or MLOps specialist. We’re looking for a well-rounded software engineer with a passion for AI and a track record of building real-world products. You’ll need:
 



  




* A strong background in
 **software engineering -** 
 beneficial if this is full-stack exp.
* Experience building and integrating
 **GenAI solutions** 
 into production environments.
* Proficiency in
 **Node.js/TypeScript** 
 , with additional experience in
 **Python** 
 ,
 **Go** 
 , or
 **PHP** 
 .
* Familiarity with
 **AWS** 
 (especially Bedrock);
 **GCP** 
 experience is also welcome.
* Solid understanding of
 **LLMs** 
 ,
 **RAG** 
 , and
 **agentic AI workflows** 
 .
* Experience working in
 **microservice architectures** 
 .
* A proactive, collaborative mindset and the ability to thrive in a fast-moving, startup-style environment.



  





 🌍 Why Join?
 


* **Greenfield opportunity** 
 : Be the first hire in a brand-new AI team with huge growth potential.
* **Impact** 
 : Your work will directly shape the future of the product and the company’s AI capabilities.
* **Flexibility** 
 : Hybrid working model in Stockholm - on-site a few days a week for collaboration.
* **Compensation** 
 : Competitive salary.
* **Benefits** 
 : 30 days’ holiday, wellness and home office allowances, ITP1 pension, and more.
* **Culture** 
 : A supportive, people-first environment with a flat structure and strong engineering culture.



  





 This is a rare opportunity to join a company at the start of its AI journey and make a lasting impact. If you're excited by the idea of building something from scratch and leading the way in GenAI innovation - this is your moment.
 



  





**Apply now and help our client shape the future of AI.**

title: Data Engineer
description:
Vi söker en erfaren Fabric Data Engineer till ett uppdrag inom en större svensk organisation i finans-/försäkringssektorn. Uppdraget är en del av ett MVP-initiativ som syftar till att etablera en modern analysplattform i Microsoft Fabric, med målet att förbättra datatillgänglighet, analyskapacitet och möjliggöra ett mer datadrivet arbetssätt samt AI-baserade lösningar.
   

  

**Uppdragets syfte**
**Uppdraget fokuserar på att:**
* Lägga grunden för en hållbar, skalbar analysmiljö i Microsoft Fabric
* Bygga datapipelines och logik från källsystem till guldlager
* Leverera två MVP-rapporter (bemanning och kostnadsuppföljning)
* Skapa en demopresentation som demonstrerar den nya plattformens potential


**Arbetsuppgifter:**
* Hämta in data från flera källor och bygga dataflöden enligt lösningsdesign
* Validera att hela flödet från källsystem till guldlager fungerar som avsett
* Stödja organisationen i övergången till Fabric, inklusive dokumentation och utbildning
* Förbereda och genomföra demopresentationer för interna intressenter


**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Flera års erfarenhet av data engineering och ETL/ELT-flöden
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Microsoft Fabric, Data Factory, Synapse eller liknande verktyg
* God förståelse för datamodellering, pipeline-design och datakvalitet
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och bidra med teknisk vägledning

title: Financial Data Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We’re hiring a full-stack analyst to build the financial brain of Lovable. You’ll own our core revenue and retention metrics, stitch together product and billing data, and help the business make fast, informed decisions. The perfect mix of finance rigor and product-minded execution.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* 3-6 years in data, analytics, or finance - ideally at a fast-growing SaaS or product-led company
* Deep experience building and maintaining revenue/ARR models
* Strong SQL and hands-on modeling experience with billing and product data
* Comfortable working across the stack: raw data → DBT model → dashboard → executive summary
* Structured thinker who can simplify messy data into meaningful metrics
* Clear communicator - writes sharp, concise docs and knows how to present tradeoffs


**What You’ll Do**
* Design the ARR model that tracks every dollar, across PLG, sales, upsell, and churn
* Partner with finance and product to lock in metric definitions that everyone can rally around
* Unify product data, billing systems (Stripe), ERP (Light) and CRM (Attio) into one clean, auditable pipeline
* Give leadership and operators the tools to see what’s working, and act fast when it’s not
* Build automated checks, flag data drift, and make sure what we report is always right
* Act fast. Think long. Help drive key decisions now, while building infrastructure that will scale with us.


**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an intro call with the team.
* Complete the take-home exercise
* Show us how you approach problems during two technical interviews
* Join us for trial work lasting 2 days preferably on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: Performance Testspecialist
description:
*Vill du vara en nyckelperson i att säkerställa att våra IT-system och applikationer levererar hög prestanda och tillgänglighet? Som Performance Testspecialist* 
*hos oss får du en central roll i att bygga upp och vidareutveckla vårt ramverk för prestandatestning. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö med engagerade kollegor som strävar efter att skapa robusta och skalbara lösningar för framtiden.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som Performance Testspecialist inom prestandatestning får du en central roll i att säkerställa att våra IT-system och applikationer lever upp till högt ställda krav på prestanda och tillgänglighet. Rollen innebär att du arbetar i en dynamisk och komplex miljö där du bidrar till att bygga upp och vidareutveckla vårt arbete med prestandatestning. Du samarbetar nära utvecklingsteam och andra intressenter för att skapa robusta och skalbara lösningar som möter verksamhetens behov.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Utforma och genomföra omfattande prestandatester end-to-end.
* Bygga upp och vidareutveckla ett gemensamt ramverk för prestandatestning.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att integrera prestandatester tidigt i utvecklingsprocessen.
* Identifiera flaskhalsar och analysera svarstider, resursanvändning och andra prestandametriker.
* Stödja och coacha team i att utföra egna prestandatester.
* Bidra till CI/CD-pipelines med automatiserade prestandatester.
* Delta i kapacitetsplanering och utvärdera testmiljöer.


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av prestanda- och lasttestverktyg såsom LoadRunner, JMeter, K6 eller NeoLoad.
* Kunskap om olika testtyper: load-, stress-, soak-, spike- och capacity testing.
* Förmåga att analysera loggar, metriker och skapa tydliga rapporter.
* Erfarenhet av testautomatisering och CI/CD-integrering (t.ex. Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps).
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom nätverk, databaser, cachelösningar, containrar och operativsystem.
* Erfarenhet av observability-verktyg och logghantering (t.ex. ELK, Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana).
* Erfarenhet av prestandamätning och optimering i OpenShift/Kubernetes-miljöer.


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att etablera teststrategier och ramverk för prestandatestning.
* Aktivt arbetat med "shift-left" och samverkan med utvecklingsteam för tidig testning.
* Erfarenhet av NeoLoad och dess tillhörande verktyg (NeoLoad Web, NeoLoad Cloud, NeoLoad as-code).
* Kunskap om APM-verktyg som Dynatrace, Jaeger eller AppDynamics.
* Erfarenhet av scriptutveckling i Python, JavaScript, Groovy eller Bash.
* Erfarenhet från reglerade branscher som bank, finans eller offentlig sektor.


 Som person är du analytisk och noggrann med en känsla för detaljer. Du har en god förmåga att arbeta strukturerat med komplexa system och är en stark kommunikatör på både svenska och engelska. Du är självgående men också en lagspelare som trivs med att samarbeta med andra. Med ditt driv och din lösningsorienterade inställning tar du initiativ och driver arbetet framåt.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Du blir en del av ett team som ansvarar för krav, DevSecOps, test, release och utvecklingsverktyg för Länsförsäkringar Bank. Vi har högt i tak och strävar efter att vara proaktiva och innovativa i vårt arbete. Teamet består av en bra blandning av åldrar och kön, vilket skapar en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Länsförsäkringar Bank är idag Sveriges femte största bank och erbjuder ett brett sortiment av produker och tjänster till våra privat-, företag- och lantbrukskunder. I arbetet mot vår vision "Tillsammans skapar vi trygghet och möjligheter" hoppas vi att du vill bidra med ditt engagemang och nyfikenhet för effektivisering, AI samt omvärldsspaning av moderna verktyg och metoder för att driva vår utveckling framåt
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-15**

title: Data Engineer (Team lead)
description:
På Capgemini får du möjlighet att forma din karriär på ett sätt som passar dig, med stöd av en global gemenskap av experter som inspirerar och ger dig kraft. Vi tror på att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt - att använda teknik för att bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande värld. Vårt Insights & Data-team är i framkant av denna mission och levererar helhetslösningar inom Data & AI över olika industrier. Med över 800 specialister i Norden utnyttjar vi strategiska partnerskap med Google, AWS, Microsoft, Databricks och Snowflake för att skala Data & Analytics i molnet. Här är din expertis och ditt perspektiv viktigt - anslut dig till oss för att driva innovation och transformera industrier med banbrytande datalösningar!
   

  

 Är du redo att ta din karriär till nästa nivå? Vi söker nu vår nästa Team Lead inom AI & Data Engineering-enheten – en roll som kombinerar ledarskap och praktiskt arbete.
   

  

**Om rollen**
*Som Data Engineer med fokus på Azure eller Databricks kommer du att:*
* Designa och bygga datapipelines med Databricks och Apache Spark för att hantera data i Azure.
* Utveckla och underhålla säkra datalager och data lakehouses med datamodeller och kvalitetskontroller.
* Bygga och distribuera AI/ML-modeller med Databricks ML och Azure ML för affärsinsikter.
* Övervaka samt optimera datapipelines och infrastruktur för effektivitet och skalbarhet.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för framgångsrika implementationer.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad inom det ständigt föränderliga landskapet av big data-teknologier och bästa praxis.


*Som Team Lead kommer du att:*
* Leda ett team på 5-10 konsulter. Du kommer att stötta ditt team med coachning och skapa en positiv och motiverande arbetsmiljö.
* Ha fokus på dina teammedlemmars individuella karriärutveckling. Genom regelbundna one-on-one-samtal hjälper du dina konsulter att planera sina karriärer och nå sina mål. Du blir den person våra anställda vänder sig till för vägledning och stöd.
* Vara en del av ledningsgruppen inom AI & Data Engineering.
* Vi tror på att ge våra chefer möjlighet att prioritera människor och kunder framför administrativa uppgifter.


**Din profil**
* Flerårig erfarenhet inom Data Engineering
* Dokumenterad expertis inom exempelvis Azure, Databricks, Apache Spark och utveckling av datapipelines samt stark förståelse för datalagerkoncept och praxis.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure-molnplattform, inklusive Azure Data Lake Storage, Databricks och Azure Data Factory.
* Kunskap om SQL och skriptspråk som Python samt praktisk erfarenhet av AI/ML-koncept och verktyg.


**Observera:** 
 På grund av semestertider kan handläggningen av din ansökan ta längre tid än vanligt. Vi återkommer under augusti. Tack för ditt tålamod!
   

  

**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Vi förstår vikten av flexibelt arbete. Oavsett om det är distansarbete eller flexibla arbetstider, kommer du att få en miljö som hjälper dig att upprätthålla en hälsosam balans mellan arbete och fritid.
* I hjärtat av vårt uppdrag ligger din karriärutveckling. Vårt utbud av karriärutvecklingsprogram och olika yrken är utformade för att stödja dig i att utforska en värld av möjligheter.
* Utrusta dig med värdefulla certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna såsom Databricks, Azure, Fabrics eller Snowflake.

title: Controls Engineer , EMEA Controls
description:
DESCRIPTION


At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.  

  

The Global Services team is looking for exceptional individuals to join our Controls team as Controls Engineer, responsible for the building automation systems within Amazon . If you are passionate about the Customer Experience, think and act globally and have the ability to contribute to major new innovations in the area of building controls and automation this is the challenge you are looking for!  

  

The ideal candidate will possess a construction management, mechanical, electrical or technology background that enables him/her to undertake the challenges of sophisticated controls platforms and a demonstrated ability to think broadly and strategically in aligning building controls and automation with the larger objectives of the business.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

* Understanding of: electrical diagrams, control diagrams, building operations, control circuits, industrial HVAC.
* Ability to ascertain customer needs to help develop scope and specifications.
* Ability to manage scope of work relative to the site specifics and customer needs.
* Ability to manage engineering to determine the scope of work relative to the design intent of the customer needs.
* Ability to read and interpret specifications and implementing those specifications as they apply the work environment.
* Development of control panel BOM’s.
* Development of ISA sheets for temperature, level, flow, and pressure transmitters along with ISA sheets for control valves, positioners, analytical, and various other types of instrumentation.
* Development of drawings for control panels, power distribution, junction boxes. Included in the drawings are the general arrangement, internal layout, schematics and interconnection and wire diagrams.
* Development of logic diagrams in the International Automation format for complex logic devices such as Programmable Logical Controller and Distributed Control System.
* Preparation of cable, routing plans and schedules.
* Performing inspects, testing, and commission of the facility systems.
* Work individually and as part of a team to develop new products, support existing products, test and evaluate equipment.
* Provide technical assistance as needed to internal customers.
* Coordinate work internally within the department and externally with other departments to ensure on-time completion of projects within budget.
* Manage service contracts with various vendors.
* Must be business proficient in the English language.

  

A day in the life  

Controls Engineer's day may begin with deployment efforts including on-site site management works , directing Controls vendors for installation / commissioing works and is responsible for quality and on time delivery of the tasks / project. While managing service works, CE will co-ordinate with Operations teams for permits and engages Vendor or performs services confirming to the task lists.  

  

About the team  

About the team  

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.  

  

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.  

  

Diverse Experiences  

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  

  

Why AWS?  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.  

  

Mentorship & Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* B.S. in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering, Engineering Technology, HVAC, or other related engineering degree, OR 5+ years related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* 2+ years of experience in project coordination with multiple teams or vendors to meet project requirements.
* 3+ years of experience with installation, configuration, or servicing, one or more of the following products; Siemens: Apogee, Honeywell: Building Controls, Trend: Building Controls, Schneider Electric: PowerLogic/Struxureware, Rockwell Automation: FactoryTalk, Tridium: Niagra, Eaton: Foreseer, ABB: Decathalon, Johnson Controls: Metasys
* Windows Power User skill set, proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, and project management software.

  

  

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Demonstrated understanding of engineering documentation, electrical diagrams, and standard operating procedures.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work both independently and in a team environment.
* Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills.
* Demonstrated success in leading teams in construction or development environment.
* Ability to manage multiple (3-12) stakeholder deliverables, requirements, and navigate difficult situations.
* Demonstrated experience developing and justifying budgets, and managing financial performance.
* Experience managing capital projects ranging from $50K to $10M.
* Demonstrated experience developing, managing, or validating performance specifications and requirements.
* Ability to communicate to vendors and make decisions using industry standard knowledge (Controls theory, protocols Modbus / BACnet, mechanical / electrical systems, passive infrastructure).
* Demonstrated experience expanding Controls knowledge base – new systems, technology, etc.
* Experience working in data centers or other critical facilities.
* Project Management Professional (PMP).
* Willing and able to travel domestically and internationally up to 25% of the time.

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Network/ Solution Specialist
description:
* **Job ID:** R0012417
* **Date posted:** 16/07/2025
**Company description*** IKEA Industry, part of the Inter IKEA Group, is the world’s largest producer of wooden furniture and is an integrated part of the IKEA value chain. As an IKEA in-house manufacturing business, we create competitive advantages that move and challenge the total IKEA value chain. IKEA Industry has more than 30 production units, across 18 sites in 7 countries: Poland, Slovakia, Portugal, Sweden, Lithuania, China and Hungary. Our operations include sawmills, boards, furniture components and furniture production. IKEA culture and values shape everything we do. Not only do the IKEA values bring us together, but they also help us to do business successfully.
* Learn more about IKEA Industry here:  

https://www.inter.ikea.com/en  

https://www.instagram.com/ikeaindustry/  

https://inter.ikea.net/en/home/IKEA-Industry (only internal Inter can view this)
 **Job description*** In this position, you will work in the Infrastructure team, supporting and ensuring that the IKEA Industry network is providing the necessary capabilities for our manufacturing business today and for the future.
* *This is an exciting challenge for You who wants to*...
* Join our Infrastructure team as a network specialist;
* + Drive and develop a strong IT & OT foundation including connectivity, integration and data flows with cyber security at the top of your mind
	+ Be the expert in supporting and improving the current platforms and services
	+ Work with new solutions and technologies
	+ Be innovative and bring future ideas to our business
	+ Being a functional solution expert for users and stakeholders
* TOGETHER AS A TEAM  

The Digital Operations team's responsibility is to provide rock solid digital platforms and solutions for manufacturing business. In this role you will report to the Team Manager for Infrastructure, and you will work closely together with the network of Unit IT and OT experts across our Units. You will also be highly involved in IKEA Industry's program Manufacturing System of the Future.
 **Qualification*** Do you want to create the solutions of the future at IKEA Industry? Do you have a natural curiosity for new technologies, got some years of Network Technician experience with good working knowledge around Cisco products? - then this might be your next step!
* *We think you will be motivated by this position if You...*
* + Have 3 years of proven network experience.
	+ Have experience from working with LAN, WLAN, SASE and SD-WAN.
	+ Knowledge of Cybersecurity and can translate NIST framework to solutions.
	+ Good working knowledge of networking hardware, especially from Cisco. Mainly Catalyst 9K, IE3x00, C9800, FTD and FMC.
	+ Have experience from working with NAC, mainly Cisco Identity Services Engine.
	+ Have proven experience working under pressure, can prioritize and lead yourself and others to take the right action.
	+ Have experience working with complex problems and are motivated to solve them.
	+ Academic degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equal working experience.
	+ Experience working in a manufacturing and/or an international organization.
	+ Strong communication skills in English, both verbal and written.
	+ Are a humble person with willpower and the ability to create togetherness and enthusiasm around you.
* *We see it as some bonus points if You have...*
* + Experience with Cisco DNA Center.
	+ Experience with Secure Web Gateway solutions.
	+ Experience with DDI (DNS, DHCP and IPAM).
	+ Knowledge around Dot1x and endpoint AAA.
	+ Knowledge of Cisco Software Defined Access.
	+ Experience with Cloud/SaaS, mainly Azure.
	+ Experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes.
  

**More Information*** Location for this position is at our office in Malmö, Sweden or in IKEA Industry Portugal, Pacos. The position requires some global travel.
* **Note that relocation is not offered for this position and candidates must have a valid work permit.**
* We enjoy the summer and vacation so the process may take additional time to finalize but we may close the ad sooner if we find our new colleague.
* Do you feel challenged and inspired by what you have seen in this job ad? If “yes!” we appreciate **your application as soon as possible**, but no later than **August 17**.
* For questions about the recruitment process, please contact our P&C Leader, Lena Vollbrecht lena.vollbrecht@inter.ikea.com. Note that it is vacation times so during July 21 until 11 August no answers will be answered.
* **Please send us your English CV**, don’t forget to tell us why you would be a good fit for this role. We look forward to receiving your application!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Cloud Platform Engineer - Google Cloud
description:
**Cloud Platform Engineer – Google Cloud Specialist**


We are currently seeking an experienced Cloud Platform Engineer with a strong background in Google Cloud Platform (GCP). The mission of the team is to empower product teams by simplifying and streamlining the way they build and deploy applications and data workloads within a secure and scalable GCP environment.


We’re looking for someone who has a proven track record of delivering cloud solutions at enterprise scale—someone who has made a significant impact across several projects and cross-functional teams.

### **Key Responsibilities:**

* Continuously improve the cloud landing zone (Project Factory) and the governance framework that underpins all product team operations.
* Design and develop core platform services that enhance developer efficiency and productivity—examples include BQ Quota Control, BigQuery Slot Reservations, Workload Identity Federation (WIF), Privileged Access Management (PAM), and patch automation.
* Drive automation and self-service capabilities across the platform to reduce operational overhead and increase autonomy for development teams.
* Collaborate directly with internal stakeholders, providing strategic guidance, best practices, and architectural recommendations for GCP-based solutions.

### **Required Skills and Experience:**

* Deep expertise in Google Cloud Platform services such as Compute Engine, Cloud Run, Kubernetes Engine (GKE), BigQuery, Cloud DNS, IAM, and Shared VPC.
* Demonstrated ability to architect, implement, and optimize scalable, resilient, and secure solutions on GCP.
* Hands-on experience in designing and deploying cloud landing zones, covering foundational infrastructure, network design, security policies, and access management.
* Proficient with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform, Deployment Manager, or similar, with the ability to fully automate cloud infrastructure provisioning.
* Solid background in setting up observability solutions on GCP, including monitoring, logging, and alerting, to ensure platform performance and reliability.


This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about cloud technologies, enjoys solving complex problems, and thrives in a collaborative and fast-paced environment.

**About** **Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.
