 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Solution Architect for API Solutions | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Shape the future of SEB's API platform as our next Solution Architect!
   

  

 SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you? About the role: As a Solution Architect in the API area, you’ll play a crucial role in building our API-driven platform and governance. You will contribute to the transformation of our API platforms, a highly prioritized area, ensuring seamless integrations for both our internal and external customers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the architectural work within the API area.
* Mentor and guide development teams in adopting API standards and practices.
* Coordinate the architecture change agenda for API solutions in the Business Infrastructure domain.
* Support various API transition initiatives with your expertise and experience.
* Act as an advisor to stakeholders on both the business and technology sides.
* Drive innovation by designing scalable and secure API solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align API strategies with business goals.
* Ensure the reliability and performance of API services through best practices and continuous improvement.
* Influence the future direction of our API strategies.


**To Thrive In This Role We Believe You Have**
* Experience in architecture within the API domain.
* Hands-on experience working with APIs and API platforms.
* Ability to model, visualize, and communicate architectural solutions across various technologies and platforms.
* Familiarity with modern development paradigms such as event-driven architecture, microservices, and cloud.
* Excellent communication skills, bridging both business and IT.
* Previous experience in the financial industry is a plus.
* Proficiency in English.


**Bonus Points For Experience With**
* DevOps and Continuous Delivery.
* Microservices architecture and REST APIs.
* Authentication protocols like OpenID Connect (OIDC) and OAuth.


**Ready to join?**
 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to this role. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than January 30th, 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact hiring manager Lars Lindgren lars.lindgren@seb.se (we will not process applications via email)
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here:** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Cloud infrastructure Team-lead
description:
From humble beginnings in the early 1990s, we have become connectivity partner of choice to the world’s largest content providers, operators and enterprises. In the past, our network laid the very foundations of the Internet revolution and today it’s enabling digitalization throughout business and society.
   

  

 Arelion, formerly Telia Carrier, is owned by Polhem Infra, a Swedish investment company backed by some of the largest Swedish public pension funds. We started building our network in 1993, when our Autonomous System, AS1299, was allocated, and we’ve grown organically ever since. Our network now stretches 70,000 kms across Europe, North America and Asia and lets you connect directly to more than 2,300 wholesale customers in more than 125 countries. With more than 450 local access partners around the world, we are the backbone of your business, wherever you are.
   

  

*Arelion provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by relevant local laws.*
 We are in search of an exceptional Cloud Infrastructure Team-lead with a profound mastery of AWS cloud Services. This pivotal role is centered around our organization's core platform, where you will be tasked with creating, maintaining & owning the roadmap for Arelion IT's Cloud infrastructure and coordinate Cloud engineers together with internal & external partners. you will actively be working in large scale cloud migration projects and will be responsible for create cloud-native mindset in our organization.
   

  

 Arelions IT Operations & Infra serves all of Arelions different departments, ranging from Network to HR systems.
   

  

* Define the vision of modern cloud infrastructure and build the foundation for the Digital Cloud Transformation project aiming to re-platform existing applications in order to gain maximum value from the cloud environment
* Create and apply frameworks, methods, best practices, and artefacts for our environment
* Work closely with Application Owners to analyze their needs and translate them into technical designs
* Propose and verify in PoC innovative solutions to drive further cloud adoption in Arelion
* Plan and execute re-platforming projects to take our infrastructure and application to the next level
* Work closely with systems owners and developers to help them with utilizing the benefits of using Cloud
* Orchestrate the work of Cloud Engineers and external cloud teams
* Collaborate with System Administrators to improve system management processes and tools
* Coach and mentor fellow developers on how to develop high-quality code, innovate using the latest cloud technologies, AWS services and development best practices, contribute to enhancing and improving AWS services
* Create modern support processes using Site Reliability Engineering approach
* Provide guidance to other technical teams building cloud-based solutions
* Stay current with new technology options and vendor products, evaluating which ones would be a good fit for the company
* Recommend process and architecture improvements
* Troubleshoot the system and solve problems across all platform and application domains

title: Emerging Markets Alliance Director (m/f/d)-Sweden
description:
**ROLE Overview** 




  





 Both the domestic and global landscapes continue to grow in complexity as organisations around the world evaluate, select and implement the full HCM spectrum of solutions to ensure continued expansion and prosperity.
 



  





 The Emerging Markets Alliances Director has a leading role to manage a matrix team to drive this critical activity and deliver rapid growth and expansion throughout Emerging Markets.
 



  





 Develops alliances sales strategy, identifies key alliance programs and manages a matrix team to produce significant impact on sales growth.
 



  





 Recruit, develop and manage strategic partner alliances/partnerships and opportunity pipelines and ensures the retention, growth and customer satisfaction of key accounts in the Emerging Markets
 



  





 Evaluates program trends and provides analysis and recommendations to management.
 



  





 Works toward mutual goals, strategies, and objectives to build awareness and support of overall strategic benefits of the alliance in the assigned regions.
 



  





 Provides for financial analyses, long-range forecasting and analysis studies associated with potential alliances/partnerships.
 



  





 Monitors programs to assess the sales impact of the solution(s) in the markets and the overall success of the alliances. Monitors competitor activity in accounts and implements strategies to maintain account ownership and block competitor advancement.
 



  





 In this role of Emerging Markets Alliances Director
 



  




* Has the remit to lead a matrix team to conceive, develop, implement all the necessary activities to ensure that ADP maximizes revenue performance of Partners including Technology, Service, System Integrators and Consultancies will proactively develop and deliver their assigned sales plan in local, regional and Multinational Sales opportunities through driving opportunity, influence and leads to the ADP domestic and Global Sales teams.



  




* Will be aligning and working with ESI Alliances management, Field Sales leaders, Marketplace leaders, and Strategic Alliances colleagues in the USA.



  




* Manages and works with a matrix team to execute on regional alliances sales plan, roll out key alliance program, expand partner ecosystem into new markets, and accelerate sales growth across Emerging Markets.



  




* Partners and collaborates across Business, Product and Marketing Leadership and peer Alliance partners providing alignment to Field Sales, Marketing, Sales Operations, Sales Support and Operations. Driving actions, mutual initiatives, field activity and aligned sales strategies to promote and increase pipeline, opportunities, deal velocity and value in the target region.



  




* Oversee alliances support for key deals in Emerging Markets involving alliance partners.



  





 KPIS will be defined and agreed, results will be measured by individual and team performance such as Alliances strategic connects, Partner leads, Pipeline activity and growth, and milestones of ESI strategic partnership models.
 



  





  





**RESPONSIBILITIES include & not limited to** 




  





 1. Manage and execute on the Alliances Partner strategy for Inside and Field sales in the assigned regions to deliver against the ESI wide Alliances Sales Plan.
 



  





 2. Identify, develop and maintain a strong network of partners and influencers in the Emerging Markets that will become a key structure to facilitate and support growing sales activity as a result of partner alignment, trust and understanding of ADP’s differentiating solutions.
 



  





 3. Align closely with both in-country, regional and global Alliances Partners to ensure ADP strategies are fully communicated, aligned and executed consistently to drive the very best in results with our partners.
 



  





 4. Lead and support the execution of marketing and opportunity identification programs and assist in creation of sales messaging deployment both through collateral and the Partner Website.
 



  





 5. Work with Product Sales and Business Consultancy education and coordination of training efforts for our Alliances Partnerships and partner closely with our Business Consultancy organisation
 



  





 6. Create and deploy industry knowledge and expertise within their geographic area of responsibility.
 



  





 7. Report market information of the assigned regions to the sales and alliances leaderships regarding competitors’ efforts in the channel, pricing awareness, sales inhibitors, and successes in the field
 



  





 8. Lead and interface between Sales Management and other functional ADP groups (BC, products, operations, marketing, etc.) in the assigned regions.
 



  





 9. Develop and drive ESI strategic alliances partners in sales process with Sales leadership through periodic reviews with focus on: standard and referral activity (inbound/outbound lead flow), partner updates and campaigns, and key partnership initiatives.
 



  





 10. Work closely with ADP GM, ESI Sales DVPs and ESI Alliances VP on strategy and execution of Alliances Strategy in Emerging Markets.
 



  





 11. Lead and manage a matrix team, providing guidance and support and implement talent development strategies.
 



  





 11. Communication: Provide regular progress update, KPIs, key actions and activities to ESI Sales DVPs and Alliances leadership.
 



  





 11. Travel to different geographic areas if required to lead partner discussions and activities in the assigned regions.
 



  





  





**REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS** 




  





 1A. Supervisors: VP of Global Alliances and Channels, ESI (Direct line), VP of Sales, Emerging Markets (Dotted line)
 



  





 B. Supervision Received: General Direction
 



  





 2. Supervisory Authority: Manage a matrix team, drive performance assessment.
 



  





**PROFILE** 




  





 1.
 **Education** 
 : Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or Business Administration preferred.
 



  





 2.
 **Experience** 
 : 20+ experience in international field sales management experience or an alliance partnership management position in a wide geographic area. Previous business services and/or business software experience required.
 **Experience in HR Advisory / management consulting and complex HCM Sales a plus** 
 .
 



  





 Has a solid understanding of business, financials, HCM products/services, and competitor landscape in the assigned regions. Has partner network and executive connections with key partners in Emerging Markets. Has experience in leading and managing a multi-cultural team with direct /indirect supervision.
 



  





  





 3.
 **Generic Skills** 
 : Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills are required. Multilingualism is a plus. Conceptualize, negotiate and sell ideas internally and externally is essential. Generate and implement concepts, ideas, and plans while functioning in a flexible, constantly changing environment is necessary. Must be a strong team leader and player.
 



  





 Anticipates and understands client/account needs; articulates competitive advantage of product/services to provide solutions. Uses judgment, discretion and ingenuity to persuade clients to adopt a favourable view and decide to buy. Leverages internal and external relationships to ensure positive client experience to encourage additional business. Builds relationships with key external influencers.
 



  





**LOCATION: Stockholm, Sweden; Copenhagen, Denmark; Netherlands** 




**AUTOMATIC DATA PROCESSING Employer Services International** 




 JOB TITLE –Emerging Markets Alliance Director
 



  





**BASIC FUNCTION** 




  





 Lead and manage a matrix team to define, nurture, develop and implement an effective programme for Technology, Service and Consultancy partners across Emerging Markets.
 



 Identify, drive and on board partners in the Emerging Markets with assigned KPIs
 



 Working with both ADP BoB and Global solutions and focused on ESI Headquartered organisations in the assigned regions.
 



 Manage a matrix team and coach and develop talent in the Alliance organization.
 



**ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES** 




  





 1. Attain or exceed 100% of assigned individual and alliances team quotas.
 



 2. Lead a matrix team to work with direct sales team members in the assigned regions
 



 • Meet regularly with key stakeholders to determine if Business Plan goals are on target.
 


* Develop a regional business plan which defines how the team will obtain alliance sales objectives.



 • Prepare a monthly situation report highlight key agreed KPIs
 



 • Maintain a sense of urgency, an attention to detail regarding situations that affect new sales, client retention and employee morale.
 



 3. Supervise a matrix team and manage the administrations and talent development
 



 4. Collaborate with regional operation management and team when required to ensure quality sales and retention of clients.
 



 5. Oversee and organize partner executive meetings in Emerging Markets

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
Uppdrag – Lösningsarkitekt
   

  

 Vi söker en erfaren lösningsarkitekt till ett omfattande förändringsinitiativ där ett nytt kärnsystem ska införas samtidigt som ett befintligt system successivt avvecklas. Samtidigt pågår ett större strategiskt program där en ny målarkitektur etableras för att framtidssäkra hela den tekniska plattformen och stödja verksamhetens långsiktiga mål.
   

  

 Som lösningsarkitekt kommer du att bidra med ett helhetsperspektiv och översätta arkitekturstrategi till konkreta, affärsdrivna och genomförbara lösningar. Ditt arbete blir avgörande för att säkerställa teknisk koherens, spårbarhet till verksamhetens mål samt robusta och hållbara lösningsförslag över tid.
   

  

 Ditt uppdrag:
   

  

* Översätta målarkitektur till realiserbara lösningar som möter både tekniska och affärsstrategiska behov.
* Bidra med teknisk riktning i program och projekt med komplex systempåverkan.
* Samarbeta tvärfunktionellt för att säkerställa att lösningar harmoniserar med etablerade riktlinjer och arkitekturprinciper.
* Designa lösningar i hybridmiljöer – med både lokala och molnbaserade komponenter.
* Arbeta nära både verksamhet och utveckling för att säkerställa förankring och förståelse i alla led.
* Driva arkitekturarbete iterativt, från komplexa nulägen mot framtida målbilder.


 Din profil:
   

  

* Du har minst 10 års erfarenhet av lösningsarkitektur i komplexa IT-miljöer.
* Du har förståelse för verksamhetskritiska system, gärna från försäkrings- eller finanssektorn.
* Du har tidigare arbetat med införande av standardsystem och har erfarenhet av integrationsplattformar.
* Du är bekväm i gränslandet mellan lösningsarkitektur och enterprisearkitektur.
* Du har god förståelse för hybridlösningar och molnbaserade arkitekturer.
* Du är van vid att tänka återanvändning, automatisering och långsiktig förvaltningsbarhet.
* Du är analytisk och strukturerad, med förmåga att se både detaljer och helhet.
* Du kommunicerar tydligt och anpassar dig efter olika målgrupper – såväl tekniska som affärsnära.
* Du tar initiativ, agerar självständigt och leder arkitekturarbetet med trygghet och engagemang.


 Meriterande kompetens:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av IAM-lösningar och identitetshantering.
* Tidigare arbete med processdrivna förändringsresor eller organisationsövergångar.
* Vana att arbeta i komplexa transformationsprogram där teknisk omställning kombineras med verksamhetsutveckling.


**Om Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Datacenter Team-Lead
description:
From humble beginnings in the early 1990s, we have become connectivity partner of choice to the world’s largest content providers, operators and enterprises. In the past, our network laid the very foundations of the Internet revolution and today it’s enabling digitalization throughout business and society.
   

  

 Arelion, formerly Telia Carrier, is owned by Polhem Infra, a Swedish investment company backed by some of the largest Swedish public pension funds. We started building our network in 1993, when our Autonomous System, AS1299, was allocated, and we’ve grown organically ever since. Our network now stretches 70,000 kms across Europe, North America and Asia and lets you connect directly to more than 2,300 wholesale customers in more than 125 countries. With more than 450 local access partners around the world, we are the backbone of your business, wherever you are.
   

  

*Arelion provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by relevant local laws.*
 The System Administrators team in IT Infrastructure and Workplace Services department has overall responsibility for maintaining and developing Arelion’s IT infrastructure. The System Administrator will maintain Arelion’s IT infrastructure.
   

  

 Key part of Arelions infrastructure is our own Datacenters wherein we support whole of Arelions business, in our DC team we have multiple internal specialists backed up by external vendors providing more extensive support where needed.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Responsible for the maintenance, configuration, and reliable operation of servers, networks and virtualization. Perform routine/scheduled audits of the systems, including all backups and patching
* Monitor Data Center’s health using preexisting management tools and respond to hardware issues as they arise; help build, test, and maintain new servers (Windows and Linux) - working closely with an external supplier.
* Network administration – mid-level ongoing tasks – with support from Senior Network Administrator
* Managing and developing our monitoring system Data Dog.
* Administering of CMDB system to make sure that information is up-to-date
* Troubleshoot hardware and software errors by running diagnostics, documenting problems and resolutions, prioritizing problems, and assessing the impact of issues – in collaboration with the service provider.
* Interact with the help desk and other teams to assist in troubleshooting, identify root cause, and provide technical support when needed. On-duty support might be needed.
* Provide documentation and technical specifications to IT staff for planning and implementing new or upgrades to IT infrastructure.
* Opportunity to learn AWS services by administering systems installed in AWS cloud – OS level
* Good experience with administering servers Linux
* Good experience working with VmWare
* Good experience with administering Windows servers and Active Directory
* Good knowledge of current hardware architecture – servers, storage, switches
* Good understanding of Data Centre architecture – high availability solutions
* Experience with configuring network devices
* Some experience with monitoring solutions
* General understanding of CMDB systems

title: Legal Solutions Architect
description:
**About Legora**
 We founded Legora with a simple thesis. AI is going to fundamentally change how legal work gets done. In 2023, we started as a startup called Leya in the basement of the biggest law firm in the Nordics. Through shared efforts, mutual growth, and true problem-solving, we built a product tailored to the needs of lawyers at the top firms. The spirit from those days remains.
   

  

 Today, Legora is the world’s first truly collaborative AI for lawyers. The platform is embedded in thousands of lawyers everyday life in nearly 20 countries by over 250 clients, and help them work more efficiently, accurately, and devote more time to complex problem solving and high-impact, strategic work.
   

  

 With offices in New York, London and Stockholm, we are on a mission to empower exceptional lawyers by unleashing their expertise. Our team of product builders and lawyers ship fast and innovate - with our users and clients.
   

  

 That’s where you come in...
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a sharp, systems-minded Legal Solutions Architect who will focus on Internal Tools & Product Enablement. This is a hybrid role built for someone who thrives at the intersection of legal expertise and AI-powered technology. You’ll work closely with Product, Engineering, and Growth to transform legal workflows into reusable, scalable solutions - and help shape the internal tools that power our product behind the scenes.
   

  

 From prompt engineering and workflow design to client enablement and documentation, you’ll be the architect behind some of our most impactful internal solutions. If you’re excited about legal design, generative AI, and building tools that scale - this role is for you.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 You’ll be the connective tissue between product strategy and operational execution. Specifically, you will:
   

  

**Owning our internal solution layer** 
 : You'll take end-to-end ownership of the internal libraries, configurations, and templates that bring our product to life - from prompt engineering to no-code workflows - and continuously iterate to improve performance and scalability.
   

  

* Partnering with Product Management: You'll work closely with product leaders to translate high-level product strategy and customer pain points into concrete, scalable solutions. You'll help shape feature requirements by bringing practical insight into how our tools are used to solve real-world legal challenges.
* Embedding with Growth: You'll serve as the internal counterpart to our client-facing teams - identifying patterns across use cases, validating high-leverage needs, and codifying best practices into reusable solution templates.
* Operationalizing insight: You'll help systematize how we turn customer insight into repeatable, scalable product functionality - building frameworks, documentation, and internal playbooks for common problems and use cases.
* Being a force multiplier: You'll act as an internal expert on how our tools can be best leveraged - unblocking teams, enabling faster product development, and accelerating adoption of new capabilities across our customer base.


**What You Bring**
 You’re legally trained, systems-oriented, and tech-curious. You’ve seen legal workflows up close - and you’re motivated by the chance to design better ones. You’ll thrive in this role if you:
   

  

* Have a background in law, legal operations, or legal tech - and deep understanding of legal workflows.
* Are excited by AI, automation, and building tools that enable better legal work.
* Can communicate clearly across functions - from lawyers to product managers to engineers.
* Think in systems and design for scale - not just one-off solutions.
* Have a structured, proactive approach and aren’t afraid to dive in and figure things out.
* Care about quality, but ship quickly - and improve over time.


**What We Offer**
* The chance to close meaningful deals and help shape a category-defining company.
* Fast-track career growth in a scaling, entrepreneurial environment.
* Close collaboration with senior leadership both internally and at your clients’ firms, your impact will be visible from day one.
* Competitive salary plus a transparent, high-upside equity program.
* Beautiful, centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed for focus and collaboration.


**Few companies can claim true product–market fit after just 18 months. We can** 
 , and we’re just getting started. The momentum is real, the deals are big, and the opportunity to shape the future of legal AI is still wide open. If you’re the kind of person who wants to close flagship accounts
 *before* 
 someone else does, now’s the time to join.
   

  

 If this sounds like you then we can’t wait to meet you.
   

  

**We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.**
 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
*Vill du vara en nyckelperson i att forma framtidens tekniska lösningar? Som Lösningsarkitekt hos Länsförsäkringar AB får du en central roll i att vidareutveckla och förvalta vår tekniska roadmap för Länsförsäkringar Mäklarservice AB. Här får du möjlighet att kombinera strategiskt tänkande med operativt arbete i en organisation som befinner sig i en spännande digital förflyttning.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som Lösningsarkitekt inom Mäklarstöd får du en central roll i att forma och vidareutveckla våra tekniska lösningar. Du arbetar i en miljö som kombinerar strategiska och operativa utmaningar, där du bidrar till att säkerställa att våra lösningar är moderna, effektiva och anpassade efter verksamhetens behov. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med både tekniska och affärsmässiga intressenter, och du förväntas vara en drivande kraft i vår digitala förflyttning.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Ansvara för livscykelhantering och teknisk roadmap för våra lösningar.
* Driva och genomföra analyser och förstudier.
* Fungera som tekniskt stöd och bollplank i den dagliga verksamheten.
* Bidra till Mäklarservice AB:s digitala förflyttning genom att utveckla och implementera tekniska lösningar.
* Anpassa språk och budskap till olika målgrupper för att säkerställa en gemensam förståelse.


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av lösningsarkitektur.
* Erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling.
* God kommunikativ förmåga på både svenska och engelska.
* Förmåga att arbeta i komplexa organisationer och förstå verksamhetens behov.


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från försäkringsbranschen, gärna Länsförsäkringar.
* Erfarenhet av workshopledning och processkartläggning.
* Erfarenhet av projektledning och molnbaserade lösningar.
* Kunskap inom verksamhetsarkitektur och integrationsarkitektur.


 Som person är du ödmjuk, ansvarstagande och proaktiv med ett starkt eget driv. Du har en naturlig förmåga att kommunicera pedagogiskt och tydligt med olika målgrupper, och du trivs med att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Gruppen Mäklarstöd består av åtta engagerade medarbetare samt ett antal resurskonsulter med djup expertis inom våra lösningar och Mäklarservice AB:s affärsverksamhet. Vi arbetar enligt en agil metodik där vi gemensamt planerar och prioriterar arbetet tillsammans med Mäklarservice AB.
   

  

 Länsförsäkringar befinner sig i en expansiv fas där vi satsar på att bli en alltmer datadriven verksamhet. Med en välfungerande informationsförsörjning säkerställer vi att våra intressenter får tillgång till relevant information med rätt kvalitet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att vara en del av en organisation som värdesätter samarbete, innovation och utveckling.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
***På grund av semesterperiod kan det ta längre tid att få återkoppling på din ansökan. Tack för din förståelse!***
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-08**

title: Digital Trust and Cyber Security Management Consultant, Sweden (hiring to multiple levels)
job_function: Consulting, Project Management, and Business Development
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
At Capgemini Invent, we’re on a mission to build the leading Digital Trust & Cyber Security management consulting team in Sweden, to be part of our existing Nordic team already established in Finland and Denmark. With major market opportunities on the horizon and the strength of our Nordic and global teams behind us, we’re assembling a powerhouse of entrepreneurial minds ready to take cyber security to the next level.
 



**Cyber security has never been more critical—or more exciting. We are looking for driven, entrepreneurial people who are ready to shape the future of cyber with us. If you’re passionate about cyber security and ready to help us build and lead, we want to talk to you.** 




  





 We are actively recruiting to the following roles/levels:
 


* Senior consultants
* Manager
* Senior Manager/Team Lead



  





 If you are passionate about building secure digital futures for clients and thrive at the intersection of strategy and execution, then we invite you to lead the way as the founding members of our Swedish Digital Trust & Security team.
 



  





 At Capgemini Invent, we empower businesses to navigate the ever-evolving landscape of digital transformation. As a leading management consultancy, we help clients embrace new technologies while safeguarding their critical data and assets.
 



  





**Key responsibilities include:** 



* Design, develop, and implement cutting-edge cyber and data protection strategies and cybersecurity operating models.
* Conduct performance improvement assessments and benchmarking clients' security posture against national and international standards.
* Develop robust governance, risk, and compliance frameworks, incorporating both traditional and innovative approaches.
* Guide clients through business resilience transformations, ensuring they are prepared for any crisis or disruption.
* Working aligned with leading cybersecurity management platforms & technologies.
* Champion the integration of Digital Trust & Security into cloud and digital workplace initiatives.
* Manage and collaborate closely with our Nordic Digital Trust & Security teams.



  





 We are driven by a shared purpose: Unleashing human energy through technology, data, creative and innovation for an inclusive and sustainable future.
 



  





**The person we want to invite to join our mission will likely have:** 



* Management consulting experience and proven experience in leading digital transformation projects focused on information security, data protection, or cybersecurity, and the application of cybertechnology.
* Passion for combining strategic thinking with hands-on implementation.
* High integrity, collaborative spirit, and a strong fit with our dynamic culture.
* Excellent presentation and facilitation skills.
* Familiarity with current cybersecurity management standards (ISO 2700x, NIST) is advantageous.
* Relevant certifications (ISO 2700x, CISM, CISA, CISSP) and experience with legal and regulatory requirements (EU-GDPR, NIS2) are a strong plus.
* Previous management experience, leading teams in information security, data protection, and/or cybersecurity, with a proactive approach to identifying strategic improvement areas for clients.
* Experience on sales, pre-sales, offering
* Educational background of relevance in cybersecurity , technology, or IT.
* Swedish citizenship required, fluency in Swedish and English.



  





**What We Offer:** 




 The opportunity to shape the future of a leading management consultancy practice.
 



 Collaborate with a team of passionate and talented professionals.
 



 Make a real difference for our clients, helping them thrive in today’s digital world.
 



 Build a rewarding career with a company that invests in your growth and development.
 



  





**Sounds like the next step in your career?** 




 We know some might hesitate to apply unless they meet every single requirement. If that sounds familiar, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be a better fit than you think—and we’d love to hear from you.
 **We review applications on an ongoing basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible!** 
 Please submit your application and CV in English.
 



  





**Please note:** 
 As part of our recruitment process, all candidates will be required to present valid identification for verification during the initial interview.
 



  





 Capgemini (traded as CAP on the Euronext Paris) is a leading strategic partner to companies around the world, we have leveraged technology to enable business transformation since our inception in Paris, more than 50 years ago. As the advisory and digital strategy, transformation, innovation, and creative brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in nearly 40 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,000+ strong team of strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.
 



  





 Get to know us better! Please visit www.capgemini.com/invent, or listen in to an episode of our podcast Future Sight with Capgemini Invent, available on Spotify.
 



  





 #LI-DNI

title: Director, Partner Sales – Western EMEA
description:
****Our Company****
 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
   

  

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
   

  

****Our Company****
 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
   

  

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 From the moment you wake up in the morning until you go to bed at night consider the media you consume, the adverts you see, the apps you use, the websites you browse and almost all of the shopping you do online throughout the day. Chances are that every single one of those interactions, every single one of those experiences, was touched by an Adobe product.
   

  

 We have a phenomenal opportunity to hire our new:
   

  

**Director, Partner Sales – Western EMEA**
 The role Director, Partner Sales – Western EMEA, requires an individual with strong executive leadership, partnering capability and analytical skills who can build high-performing strategic alliances that deliver business outcomes. Leading a team of Partner Sales Managers to manage named Global & Regional partners for developing and driving execution of revenue-driving programmes and initiatives, enable and certify Partners to ensure they are delivering Adobe Experience Cloud solutions to the highest possible standard.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Manage Adobe’s relationships with key global Partners, consisting of traditional Global Management Consulting Firms, Local Systems Integrators and large Digital/Ad Agencies.
* Working closely with the Western EMEA leadership to align the partner strategy with regional priorities and goals to ensure measurable partner impact from a revenue and customer success perspective.
* Manage a high performing team of Partner Sales Managers – ensuring they remain motivated and providing them with the necessary support will be a key to success.
* Working with peers in other geographies, drive and complete strategies aligned with our Global Partner Program.
* Manage and maintain the local Partner program, incentive programs and various initiatives.
* Develop executive cross partner organization contacts aligning business strategies and driving growth.
* Develop with the team partner sales plays, offerings and industry solutions to market for execution and engagement of our Adobe sales teams and Industry leads within our partner ecosystem.
* Communications – Ensure effective and timely internal and external communications.


**What you’ll need to succeed:**
* Experience working in a quota bearing enterprise Sales environment for at least 5 years, with a strong track record of achieving your targets.
* In addition, proven experience in a Partner/Alliance Sales role will be required; experience growing a Partner Sales organization would be preferred.
* Experience of driving partner pipe; sourced and influenced bookings.
* Strong relationships and experience working with Global Consulting, System Integrators and Digital Agencies.
* Ability to build and maintain positive working relationships while delivering results in a highly complex, matrixed global organization.
* People Management /virtual team management experience.


 We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation!
   

  

 Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more about our vision here.
   

  

 Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.

title: IT-arkitekt specialist
description:
**Vill du vara med och accelerera vår digitalisering inom samhällskritisk verksamhet och bidra till ett fossilfritt liv inom en generation? Hos oss får du vara med och påverka morgondagens klimatsmarta samhälle och skapa framtidens elnät** 
 .
   

  

 Vi på Vattenfall Eldistribution växer och söker nu flera kompetenta medarbetare till vårt arkitekturteam. Du kommer att tillhöra en arkitekturfunktion med bred kompetens inom Enterprise-, Verksamhets-, IT-, och Informationsarkitektur. Avdelningen för arkitektur består av cirka 15 medarbetare och konsulter med uppgiften att leda framtagandet och utvecklingen av en arkitektur som proaktivt möter framtidens krav på smarta elnät, nya energikällor och snabbt föränderliga omvärld.
   

  

 Vattenfall Eldistribution genomgår en större uppgradering av integrationsplattformen (Biztalk), omformning av den befintliga Data- och Analysplattformen samt en förflyttning mot en mer modulär IT-miljö.
   

  

 Som IT-arkitekt hos oss kommer du att driva och stödja analys- och arkitekturarbete med fokus på integration, plattformar, moln, analys och säkerhet. Du kommer även att delta i uppbyggnaden av den operativa och taktiska arkitekturförmågan inom området IT Common. Arbetet innebär nära samarbete med säkerhetsfunktionen och vår koncernövergripande IT, och du kommer att ha många samverkanspartners, både internt och externt.
   

  

 I din roll som IT-arkitekt kommer dina arbetsuppgifter och ansvar att inkludera:
   

  

* Driva samskapande och förankring av vårt framtida IT-landskap i nära samarbete med IT och verksamheten.
* Facilitera fram IT-lösningar inom och mellan våra leveransområden samt genomföra analyser, utredningar och ta fram beslutsunderlag med utgångspunkt i områden såsom data, analys, infrastruktur och integration.
* Driva arkitektur- och designarbete, analysera tekniska vägval samt guida initiativ och ta fram arkitekturdesign som följer arkitekturprinciper, målarkitektur och beslutade standarder.
* Kommunicera och visualisera arkitekturförflyttningar i roadmaps.
* Omvärldsbevaka och leda arkitekturella utvärderingar, såsom nya teknologier, verktyg och koncept tillsammans med relevanta grupper/team.
* Tillsammans med övriga arkitekter och verksamheten säkerställa att arkitekturen är uppdaterad och sammanhängande.
* Delta i vidareutvecklingen av gemensamma arkitekturmetoder och verktyg.


 Vi är inne i en förflyttning mot ett domändrivet och verksamhetsnära arkitekturarbete, och du kommer tillsammans med övriga arkitekter i teamet att vara med och forma och etablera nya arbetssätt och metoder i nära samverkan med både verksamhet och IT.
   

  

 Företagsbeskrivning
   

  

 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi ser att du har kundfokus och förmåga att se helheten. Du är bekväm med att leda och driva arkitekturarbete och kan balansera kort- och långsiktigt fokus. Du kommunicerar och visualiserar komplexa lösningar på ett enkelt och lättillgängligt sätt, är skicklig på att förankra och navigera i stora organisationer och visar ödmjukhet och respekt i samarbetet med andra. Du är också nyfiken och bra på att hålla dig à jour med vad som händer i ditt yrkesområde och i branschen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har**
* Relevant utbildning från universitet eller högskola inom IT, datavetenskap eller motsvarande.
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete i roller som exempelvis Domänarkitekt, IT-arkitekt, Lösningsarkitekt och/eller Systemarkitekt.
* Erfarenhet av större IT-moderniserings- och transformationsprojekt i komplexa IT-miljöer med molnlösningar, gärna inom transaktionstung och säkerhetsklassad verksamhet.
* Erfarenhet av Azure PaaS, API Management, Kafka, Hybrid Integrations, Databricks, Dynamics, Microservices-arkitektur, Zero Trust, IAM.
* Erfarenhet och god förståelse för informations- och dataarkitektur.
* Erfarenhet av att ta fram beslutsunderlag, utveckla, kommunicera och upprätthålla målarkitekturer och IT-roadmaps.
* Erfarenhet och förmåga att tillämpa metoder och ramverk (SAFe, TOGAF etc.) och arkitekturverktyg (Visio, Sparx Enterprise Architect etc.).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med agila metoder och iterativa leveranser.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.


 Ytterligare information
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
*Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.*
**Placeringsort**
* Solna, Luleå eller Trollhättan


**För mer information** 
 om själva tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Jenny Brodin, jenny1.brodin@vattenfall.com. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Julia Norberg, julia.norberg@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Christian Ericsson – Ledarna, Anne-Marie Sjöbohm – Akademikerna, Asim Nokic – Unionen, Ulf Tengman – SEKO.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 17-08-2025.** 
 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i ansökan. Du söker snabbt och enkelt genom att svara på urvalsfrågor och bifoga ditt CV.
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.
   

  

 Då säkerheten för Vattenfall och dess anställda är avgörande kommer vi innan varje anställning genomföra en ”pre-employment screening”. Dessa kontroller baseras på din roll som du kommer att fylla inom Vattenfall.
   

  

 Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Senior Customer Success Manager
description:
Learnster is a cutting-edge learning management system committed to revolutionizing how organizations approach employee development. Our human-centered approach blends innovative technology and AI with a dedication to empowering individuals and fostering learning cultures. Learnster comprises 30 engaged individuals, 200+ customers, and users across 30+ countries. Join us on our trailblazing journey to reshape the future of workplace individual learning!
 



  





**Job description** 




 As a Customer Success Manager at Learnster, you're not merely a point of contact—you're a strategic partner to our customers. Your responsibilities include managing a portfolio of strategic customers and ensure our customers get maximum value out of our product. Your role extends beyond providing solutions; you're a trusted advisor, a strategic thinker, and a passionate advocate for our clients' interests. You will play a crucial role in shaping our customers' success stories, building lasting relationships and contribute to Learnsters continuous growth journey.
 



  





**Your role will include** 



* Responsibility for helping our customers understand, use and get high value from our product and services.
* Run customer onboarding projects, where you take responsibility for project management, training, and coaching.
* Being a thought leader, inspiring our customers in knowledge orchestration.
* Maintain strong relationships with existing clients, ensuring satisfaction and exploring opportunities for account growth.
* Own the management and expansion of customer agreements in collaboration with your colleagues from the sales team.
* Identify both risks and opportunities by analyzing our customer data.
* Work closely with colleagues both within our team and with the rest of the organization.
* Involvement in our company's development by continuously learning and improving as a natural part of your daily work.



  





**To thrive in this role you have** 



* Experience in a similar role, preferably in a SaaS B2B Company.
* An understanding of how companies and organizations work with goals, skills development, and learning.
* An overall intererest in L&D.
* A natural ability to build relationships with people in leading positions and you are skilled in managing and exceeding their expectations.
* An ability to quickly learn new digital tools and define yourself as tech savvy.
* An independent and entrepreneurial drive with a great sense of responsibility and a focus on results.
* Teamwork skills and are eager to learn and develop, both as a person and in your work role.
* Can work from our office in Stockholm for a few days a week.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken, is required for this position. Additional languages are meritorious.



  





**What We Offer** 



* An exciting journey in a scale-up with strong investors
* Flexible work arrangements (remote/on-site)
* Health and wellness benefits
* Continuous learning opportunities within a vibrant, innovative team
* Six weeks of paid vacation plus 3 extra free days per year
* A culture that values diversity and promotes personal development



  





**We look forward to meeting you!** 



* Join a fast-growing and awarded SaaS company, where you will play a key role in shaping Learnster’s future.
* At Learnster, you will work with passionate and ambitious colleagues, ready to take ourselves, our team, and the company to the next level!



  





*Please note that we will start contacting candidates in the beginning of August.*

title: Clinical Solutions Executive
description:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.
   

  

 Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we’re working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.
   

  

 Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.
   

  

 The Clinical Solutions Executive will support Cepheid Nordics in achieving commercial goals and help Cepheid customers to fully understand and utilize the clinical benefits/impact of Cepheid technology and products. The role involves working closely with the sales team to develop pre- and post-sales strategies, support newly launched products, and boost assay utilization.
   

  

 This position is part of the Commercial Sales Department and is a remote position based in either Sweden or Finland. At Cepheid, our vision is to be the leading provider of seamlessly connected diagnostic solutions.
   

  

**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**
* Support sales strategies and execution to achieve commercial goals in the Nordics.
* Educate and train clinical stakeholders on the impact and use of Cepheid products.
* Develop strong relationships with clinicians and key opinion leaders to drive advocacy.
* Create and support business opportunities through clinical engagement and product demonstrations.
* Collaborate with Medical and Scientific Affairs on clinical case studies and product positioning.
* Stay current with clinical data and healthcare guidelines to inform strategy and communication.
* Partner with internal teams including Sales, Marketing, and Field Application Specialists to optimize customer experience.


**The essential requirements of the job include:**
* MSc or PhD degree Physician, Clinical Pharmacist, Clinical Laboratory Sciences subspecialty (Microbiology, Molecular biology), or Infectious Diseases OR Nursing degree in field
* Minimum of 8 years experience in Swedish or Finnish healthcare market
* Basic knowledge in Microbiology, Molecular biology & Infectious Diseases
* Clinical experience including evidence of implementing change in hospital/healthcare environments.
* Excellent Selling and negotiation skills.
* Fluent in English and Swedish or Finnish


**Travel, Motor Vehicle Record & Physical/Environment Requirements:**
* Ability to travel up to 30% within the Nordic region.
* Must have a valid driver’s license with an acceptable driving record.


 Cepheid, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com.
   

  

 At Cepheid we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, remote working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a remote work arrangement in which you can work remotely from your home. Additional information about this remote work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Cepheid can provide.
   

  

 Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.
   

  

 For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
   

  

 At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: Inhouse Sales Agent, Scandic Group & Meeting, vikariat
description:
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.
   

  

 Delar du våra värderingar?
   

  

**BE A PRO** 
**BE YOU** 
**BE CARING** 
**BE BOLD**
 Scandic Group & Meeting Sverige är Scandics Inhouse Sales avdelning där vi hanterar alla grupp - och mötesaffärer för våra hotell i Sverige.
   

  

 Vi tar hand om och är med kunden hela vägen från offertförfrågan fram till deras ankomst samt följer upp och hanterar faktureringen efter avresan.
   

  

 Med hög energi, bra samarbete och en riktig ”nu kör vi” anda arbetar vi för att erbjuda en bekymmersfri kundresa i världsklass och leverera bästa möjliga service till våra gäster.
   

  

**Vi behöver nu stärka upp med nya, härliga kollegor till vårt kontor i Solna och söker efter engagerade Inhouse Sales Agents som brinner för affären och service!**
**Nu söker vi efter dig som vill vara med och koordinera sportgrupper för utvalda hotell i hela Sverige**
 Sporten är ett viktigt och stort segment för Scandic och innefattar allt från mindre grupper på 15 personer till stora cuper, mästerskap och landslagsbokningar.
   

  

 Du är gästens primära kontaktperson från och med att bokningen bekräftas och ansvarar för att detaljplanera hela bokningen inklusive fakturering och uppföljning av genomförandet tillsammans med kund. Du kommer även ha möjlighet att arbeta med införsäljning och offerthantering av grupper.
   

  

 Du, ditt team och din Area Inhouse Sales Manager jobbar nära och tillsammans med alla våra hotell i Sverige
   

  

 Som Inhouse Sales Agent behöver du vara lyhörd, noggrann och ha en vilja att leverera service på högsta nivå. Du är kreativ, drivs av försäljning, har ett positivt bemötande gentemot kollegor och kunder och har lätt för att samarbeta. Vi vill att du är modig, tar initiativ samt vågar komma med nya förslag och idéer. Att du brinner för goda kundrelationer och att din kommunikativa förmåga är på topp ser vi som en självklarhet.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att din prestation medverkar till att teamet når sina mål och att kunderna upplever fantastisk service. Du och ditt team bidrar starkt till att kunderna återvänder till oss på Scandic.
   

  

 Vi vill att du tar med dig din kultur och erfarenheter för att tillsammans med dina kollegor bidra till att inspirera och utveckla Scandic Group & Meeting.
   

  

 Att du både pratar och skriver flytande på Svenska och Engelska är ett krav. Tidigare erfarenhet av liknande arbete, Scandic och kunskaper i Opera Cloud är starkt meriterande. För denna roll är även erfarenhet av hotelldrift och koordiering av stor vikt.
   

  

 Vi sitter på vårt kontor i Solna Business Park och arbetstiden är fördelad mellan 07.00-17.00 på vardagar. Helger och kvällar kan förekomma.
   

  

 Tjänsterna är vikariat på ungefär ett år med start så snart som möjligt. Vi kommer att ha intervjuer löpande med ett kort uppehåll i semestertider
   

  

 Inom Scandic hotels finns stora möjligheter till vidareutveckling efter avslutat vikariat, antingen hos oss på Scandic Group & Meeting eller på något av våra hotell.
   

  

 Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kommer tillsättas så snart som möjligt, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic Group & Meeting!
   

  

 Det här är en anställning med vikariat på heltid.

title: Senior Data Analyst @ COOP aibi
description:
**For a Sustainable Future Together**
 Coop is Sweden's largest cooperative and a leading player in the grocery retail sector, with over 4 million members. We focus heavily on sustainability and work to create a greener and more just future by offering sustainable products and services.
   

  

**At Coop, We Live Our Values Every Day**
* Welcoming: We are inclusive, interested, and considerate in our work to create a positive and supportive work environment.
* Inspiring: We are generous and innovative, passionate about always doing our best for our members.
* Brave: We stand up for what we believe in, are transparent, and dare to lead change.
* Responsible: We deliver on our promises and take responsibility for future generations, both in the workplace and in society.


 We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences is key to creating a more inclusive and successful workplace. Therefore, we welcome everyone, regardless of gender, age, background, or ethnic origin.
   

  

**Help us democratize an industry leading Data Platform - Apply for the role as Senior Data Analyst at Coop AIBI.**
 At Coop we are boldly going where no one has gone before, creating new standards within the industry as a whole. We are not exactly sure what the future of the Swedish food industry will look like, but we know that data, and your analytical capabilities will be shaping it.
   

  

 Team AI and Business Intelligence are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Analytics branch. You will bring your analytical skills to the table to develop data and insights solutions that help our needs in saving time and money, improving health and providing sustainable food.
   

  

 If that sounds interesting - wait until you hear what you actually will work with:
   

  

* Dive into massive amounts of data residing on a state of the art delta lake platform.
* Coach Coop to work harder, better, faster and stronger with data to change our business for the better
* Set an example by delivering clear, actionable insights through dashboards or in-depth analytical investigations


 While doing this, you will also belong to an awesome team of data people (analysts, scientists and engineers)
   

  

**What Can I Expect From The Role**
* Work with making sense of various types of data from different sources, such as receipts, logistic order , and online click data.
* Cooperate with different parts of the organisation, such as procurement, logistics, sales, and marketing.
* Engage in analytics engineering, dashboard creation, and generating insightful PowerPoint presentations.


**Skills We Value**
 While great resumes are great, we also believe that you can come a long way with the right analytical mindset and can-do attitude! We are looking for candidates that are:
   

  

* Swedish speaking, with a business acumen and willingness to understand modern retail challenges.
* Self sufficient (i.e. chat GPT) when it comes to programming tasks with python, or acquiring data from relational databases (SQL)
* Awarded a degree in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or numerate subject.


**Hopefully, You Possess One Or Many Of These Skills/experiences**
* Expertise in pushing insights through modern BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik)
* Experience with (git) version control
* Familiar with statistics or machine learning concepts to know when there’s a time and place for that
* Experience from a cloud data environment (Azure, GCP or AWS)


**What does Coop offer?**
* A place for personal growth - you will work with several degrees of freedom and with that comes great responsibilities
* A place to develop your hard skills - whether it’s the latest cloud technologies or stakeholder management
* A place for fun - a prestige less environment where we try to focus on what actually matters - creating value for our members!


 Coop HQ is located in Solna Business Park, about 10 minutes from the city centre. It is a spacious office with a green slide leading you down to the company restaurant - because great, environmentally friendly food is what it’s all about in the end.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 If this sounds like a challenge for you, submit your application as soon as possible, as we are conducting ongoing selection and interviews throughout the summer period. To ensure a fair match between candidates and the role's requirements, we will use tests as part of the selection process. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to contact recruiting manager Emil Nilsson emil.nilsson@coop.se
   

  

**Please note:** 
 Due to the summer holiday period, the recruitment process for this position will slow down temporarily. We will resume the selection process in
 **week 32** 
 . Thank you for your patience and understanding!

title: Regional Support Engineer/Remote Service Leader NE Radio-Pharmacy Nordics
description:
**Job Description Summary**
 In this role, you'll be responsible for providing on-site and remote support to internal and external customers using applicable technology and remote tools. You'll also act as the Technical focal point for Radio-Pharmacy modality within the region, for all major modality initiatives within New Product Introduction (NPI).
   

  

 You'll be utilising all tools available to help drive Remote Fix Rate (RFR) and First Call Resolution (FCR), proactively support customer service / satisfaction initiatives within the Region, provide technical support to Zone Service Managers, Field Service Engineers, and the Sales Force throughout the region as well as develop the technical expertise of field service engineers.
   

  

 GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Job Description**
* Deliver on the Case Management approach for Hard Down systems, utilising tools, and resources to ensure minimal down time for customers.
* Support the Customer Service Opportunity (CSO) process utilising and developing strong global networks to achieve quality outcomes for Northern Europe (NE) customers.
* Project leadership in areas such as product serviceability and reliability and quality trend analysis.
* Provide feedback to Service Engineering/Manufacturing to address ongoing quality issues and be up to date on technical aspects in relation to remote service.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of modality products, service expertise, and tools.
* Support NPI & End of Life (EOL) programs in partnership with modality and commercial teams.
* Support the deployment phase of Field Modification Instruction’s (FMI’s) and ensure delivery teams are equipped to execute.
* Provide on-site technical support to internal and external customers where required, supporting complex troubleshooting and Installation tasks.
* Provide technical support to the region as required.
* Be part of the RSE/RSL team taking customer calls and performing site visits.
* Technical: trouble-shooting all models specific to the modality.
* New Product Introduction (NPI) interface with the Region.
* Monitor pilot products.
* Increase technical expertise of Field Engineers, set standards, Mentor, and support On Job training (OJT).
* Transfer technical information received from experience, Regional Service Engineers Network in Europe, Service Modality Leader, or On-Line Centers.
* Provide technical support to Service Modality Leader to identify opportunities for better cost / service delivery performance.
* Train and support ROLEs within the Radio-Pharmacy Modality
* Support the Service Modality Leader in driving Modality initiatives, Test Equipment, and training.
* Maintain an effective Quality System and comply with the requirements of ISO 9001, the Quality Policy and documented processes. Promptly escalate any quality or integrity issue.


**Qualifications And Requirements**
* Proven and extensive experience within Radio-Pharmacy
* Strong customer-service skills
* Excellent analytical skills.
* Project management skills.
* Strong organizational skills.
* Strong problem analysis / solving skills.
* Strong interpersonal / customer skills.
* Ability to train / mentor others.


**Desired Skills**
* Chemistry systems
* Highly motivated team-player with positive attitude.
* Ability to take on challenges quickly and effortlessly.
* Extremely high energy level / perseverance.
* Flexibility to meet the needs of a changing business environment.


**Inclusion and Diversity**
 GE HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

 We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.
   

  

 Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration, and support.
   

  

******Additional Information******
**Relocation Assistance Provided:** 
 No

title: Receptionist Scandic Grand Central, deltid  80%
description:
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.
   

  

 Delar du våra värderingar?
   

  

**BE A PRO** 
**BE YOU** 
**BE CARING** 
**BE BOLD**
* Scandic Grand Central är ett nav för kultur i Stockholm!\*\* Med konstutställningar, konserter och en egen teater är det alltid något som händer innanför de anrika väggarna. Vi som arbetar på hotellet trivs i den fartfyllda och kreativa miljön och har en gemensam vilja att erbjuda våra gäster det lilla extra. En mix av det historiska och det moderna beläget mitt i Stockholms hjärta. För dig som uppskattar en internationell och inspirerande social scen som andas musik och kultur. Om du kunde sätta ett stetoskop på Stockholms kropp skulle hjärtljuden slå högst där Scandic Grand Central är. Så vart slår dina hjärtljud? Älskar du musik, konst och kreativa miljöer lika mycket som oss? Då är du den vi söker!


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Grand Central.**
 Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.
   

  

 Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!
   

  

 Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!
   

  

**Vad är innebär rollen?**
 Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.
   

  

 Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.
   

  

 Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.
   

  

 Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.
   

  

 Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.
   

  

 Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.
   

  

**Information om tjänsten**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på deltid.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar provanställning. Din närmsta chef kommer att vara vår Receptionschef. Platsen omfattar dagskift och kvällskift under vardagar och helger. Startdatum så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!
   

  

 Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!

title: Cyber Threat Intellegence Lead
description:
Vill du vara med och forma Sveriges digitala försvar? Vill du samarbeta med europeiskt ledande Threat intelligence team samt cyber security research team?
 



 Vi söker nu en driven och strategisk Threat Intelligence Lead som vill ta ansvar för att analysera och förmedla vår Threat Intelligence, samt bygga och vårda relationer med nationella organisationer för att bidra till ett säkrare digitalt Sverige. Vi har öppning för tjänsten där vi har kontor stationerade i Sverige; Malmö, Göteborg, Stockholm, Sundsvall, Borlänge, Umeå, Östersund.
 



  





  





**Om rollen:** 




 Som Threat Intelligence Lead kommer du att ha ett övergripande ansvar för våra Threat Intelligence-paketeringar, tjänster och kontextualisera Threat Intelligence data. Ditt arbete kommer att vara avgörande för att skapa värde för våra kunder och stärka det strategiska cyberförsvaret för våra kunder inom privat och offentlig sektor. Du kommer stort utrymme att påverka att utforma rollen.
 



  





 Du kommer arbeta nära vårt Europeiskt ledande operationella Threat Intelligence-team, vår globala Security Operation Center samt det globala security research teamet. Alla dessa resurser ger oss i Sverige unika möjligheter att dra nytta av världsledande data och insikter. Syftet är att skapa en stark lokal förankring av Threat Intelligence och vår research, som ger konkret värde till våra kunder, myndigheter och andra organisationer (ex CERT.se, FRA, NCSE), som arbetar för ett säkrare digitalt Sverige.
 



  





 Du kommer att bygga och vårda strategiska relationer med kunder, nationella och internationella communities, myndigheter och andra aktörer inom cybersäkerhet. Genom att delta i och bidra till dessa nätverk, stärker du vår position som en ledande aktör i det svenska cyberlandskapet och bidrar till vårt syfte “att säkra det digitala samhället”.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:** 



* **Lokalt förankra Threat Intelligence:** 
 Säkerställa att den globala Threat Intelligence som vi får tillgång till översätts till värdefulla insikter för våra kunder och samhället i stort.
* **Affärsansvar för Threat Intelligence-tjänster:** 
 Utveckla våra erbjudanden och bidra i vår kommunikation för att möta marknadens behov, agera stöd och bidra med rågivning i kunddialoger.
* **Relationer och samverkan:** 
 Bygga och underhålla relationer med nationella communities, myndigheter och andra nyckelaktörer för att främja informationsutbyte och samarbete.
* **Strategisk utveckling:** 
 Identifiera nya möjligheter, skapa strategiska planer och driva initiativ inom området för Threat Intelligence, för att stärka Sveriges digitala säkerhet.
* **Presentationer:** 
 Bidra till utformningen av lokalt kundmaterial samt kommunicera värdet av threat intelligence.



  





**Din bakgrund:** 




 Vi söker dig som har stor erfarenhet av cybersäkerhet och Threat Intelligence, med gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta i eller med CERT-miljöer. Du är kommunikativ och med förmåga att bygga relationer och skapa förtroende, både internt och externt. Du är affärsorienterad, kundorienterad, innovativ och trivs i en roll där du kan påverka och göra skillnad.
 



  





**Krav:** 



* Flera års erfarenhet av Threat Intelligence, analys och informationsdelning.
